message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with coding theory and specifically MDS codes, which are commonly studied in the information theory community. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the construction of codes and their properties, which falls under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The repair of codes after node failure is a key aspect of the paper, which relates to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture).
